before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"9nqpl","text":"This protocol is also called \"soft lithography\" in the literature the reference protocol is taken from the manual of Sylgard 184 silicone elastomer, Dow-Corning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c5jab","text":"Microfluidics materials are of various types and application-specific. PDMS is one of the most preferred and cost-effective solutions for research and low-volume manufacturing. After having the mold, PDMS replicas are generated by a technique called soft-lithography. This protocol describes the preparation of PDMS  microchannels using SU8 molds, 3D Printed resin molds, and/or metal molds by the soft lithography technique, SLA printing, or CNC machining.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

Components are mixed well in a tube or beaker using a glass stick.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n2em","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di7qh","text":"1.2.2. The time duration required to perform the physical mixing of the Sylgard184 components must be minimum 3 minutes for 50mL tube and it can be prolonged until being sure about complete mixing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"969vd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bivqc","text":"1.2.3. Hard mixing of ingredients causes air bubbles inside which may disappear as late as an hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm0uh","text":"1.3.1. In order to remove air bubbles quickly there are two main options;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17l4e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jibv","text":"1.3.2. The mixture is centrifuged at 500g for 5 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27lp4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3dbh","text":"1.3.3. The mixture is exposed to a vacuum inside the chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bnau","text":"2.1.1. Pour the mixture into the molds which could be the SU8 mold, 3D printed mold, or metal mold, those are put inside a petri plate and leave it for around 30 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qf0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5j4rg","text":"2.1.2. Leaving for 30 minutes at RT is necessary when air bubbles are showed up during the pouring.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8afk6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ibkn","text":"2.1.3. When there are air bubbles remaining in the material, place the PDMS poured mold inside vacuum chamber for degassing for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3p120","text":"2.2.1. Heating of the PDMS in the mold has alternative options. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5jm30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"28eme","text":"2.2.2. If the mold is SU8 on a Silicon wafer then, PDMS is heated at 65Â°C for 2-3 hours on a heater plate device.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a6nr4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f32te","text":"2.2.3. If the mold is 3D printed resin or metal then, PDMS is heated at 85Â°C for 3 hours inside a heated oven.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"io50","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dt2o4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1841s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9uulv","text":"The bottom of the heater plater or heater oven must be even for not to cause defects of uneven thickness on PDMS.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"advfu","text":"3.0.1. The excess of mixed PDMS (but not heated) can be stored in a refrigerator (+4Â°C) for up to one week.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4fogs","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gc3b","text":"3.0.2. Just take from the refrigerator and pour on a new mold and incubate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7t2ed","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2hk1k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fme47","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ahdt9","text":"A longer duration for storage is not suggested since PDMS can polymerase longer even at lower temperatures.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b1dhj","text":"4.0.1. After completion of the curing time of PDMS on mold, the PDMS gel is removed carefully away from the mold. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dnpp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a8jfi","text":"4.0.2. Being gentle is important at this step not to form defects on the PDMS layer. The PDMS layer is put inside a clean petri dish or clean plastic surface.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5l6b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4vs6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ohqe","text":"This step is performed inside the class2 laminar flow hood cabinet.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Visual check of PDMS layer is performed under a digital microscope,  and these parameters are checked mainly;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"89ctq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2ulcl","text":"- Debris (Trace), air bubbles (active areas), Stains-Voids, Scratch marks, Broken PDMS, Uneven PDMS, Wrong Orientation (PDMS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Microfluidics 4: PDMS Chip Soft Lithography
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"23ij2","text":"* All the related steps must be done in a clean room classD (minimum).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"erc9c","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dk86i","text":"* Please learn well about the hazards of Sylgard 184 chemicals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
